question: Find the component at index 0 of $\mathbf{A} \mathbf{x}$, where \begin{align*} A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ -3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} && x = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 1 of $\mathbf{B} \mathbf{z}$, where \begin{align*} B = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & -1 \\ 3 & 0 & 4 \end{bmatrix} && z = \begin{bmatrix} -1 \\ 3 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 0 of $\mathbf{C} \mathbf{z}$, where \begin{align*} C = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 3 \\ -2 & 1 \\ 4 & -1 \end{bmatrix} && z = \begin{bmatrix} 2 \\ -1 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 1 of $\mathbf{D} \mathbf{w}$, where \begin{align*} D = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & -1 & 2 \\ 0 & 3 & -2 \\ 4 & -3 & 1 \end{bmatrix} && w = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 2 of $\mathbf{E} \mathbf{v}$, where \begin{align*} E = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ -2 & 4 \\ 1 & -1 \end{bmatrix} && v = \begin{bmatrix} -1 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 0 of $\mathbf{F} \mathbf{u}$, where \begin{align*} F = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -3 & 1 \\ 0 & 4 & -2 \end{bmatrix} && u = \begin{bmatrix} 3 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 2 of $\mathbf{G} \mathbf{t}$, where \begin{align*} G = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & -2 \\ 3 & 0 \\ -1 & 4 \end{bmatrix} && t = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 0 of $\mathbf{H} \mathbf{s}$, where \begin{align*} H = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1 & -1 \\ 2 & -3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} && s = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 1 of $\mathbf{J} \mathbf{p}$, where \begin{align*} J = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 & 3 \\ 4 & 0 & -2 \\ 1 & 2 & -3 \end{bmatrix} && p = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.

question: Find the component at index 1 of $\mathbf{K} \mathbf{r}$, where \begin{align*} K = \begin{bmatrix} -1 & 2 \\ 3 & 1 \end{bmatrix} && r = \begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix} \end{align*}

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Recall that matrix-vector multiplication is performed by taking the dot product of each row of the matrix with the vector.
